Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual who yearns for connection but struggles with shyness.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a poetry slam at the local library. He listened, mesmerized, as words flowed like liquid fire, expressing emotions he couldn't articulate. He longed to join them, to pour his own anxieties and dreams onto the stage, but the thought of speaking in front of an audience sent shivers down his spine. He left the library that night with a notebook full of scribbled verses, forever haunted by the courage he lacked.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to have a picnic in the beer garden of The Princess of Wales. As they laughed and shared stories, Alexander noticed a group of girls giggling at a nearby table. He longed to impress them, to show them the witty, charming person he felt he could be, but his tongue tied itself in knots. He retreated into silence, watching enviously as Jack effortlessly charmed one of the girls with his easy humor. The familiar feeling of inadequacy settled over him like a shroud.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a shy and introverted individual who desires connection and belonging but struggles with social anxiety.
          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a picnic with his friends in Victoria Park.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and hopeful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who yearns for connection but struggles with shyness.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who yearns for connection but struggles with shyness.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a poetry slam at the local library. He listened, mesmerized, as words flowed like liquid fire, expressing emotions he couldn't articulate. He longed to join them, to pour his own anxieties and dreams onto the stage, but the thought of speaking in front of an audience sent shivers down his spine. He left the library that night with a notebook full of scribbled verses, forever haunted by the courage he lacked.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to have a picnic in the beer garden of The Princess of Wales. As they laughed and shared stories, Alexander noticed a group of girls giggling at a nearby table. He longed to impress them, to show them the witty, charming person he felt he could be, but his tongue tied itself in knots. He retreated into silence, watching enviously as Jack effortlessly charmed one of the girls with his easy humor. The familiar feeling of inadequacy settled over him like a shroud.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who yearns for connection but struggles with shyness.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.

        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Context for action selection and components

Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

        • Statements:
          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:
          14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. They are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.
          Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is not experiencing any pain and is likely not thirsty or hungry.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is spending a pleasant afternoon at Victoria Park with friends on May 14, 2015. They plan to attend a soccer game later. He is not feeling any discomfort and is likely not hungry or thirsty.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is spending a pleasant afternoon at Victoria Park with friends on May 14, 2015. They plan to attend a soccer game later. He is not feeling any discomfort and is likely not hungry or thirsty.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he found himself at a pivotal crossroads. His heart pounded in his chest, the thought of exposing his vulnerable feelings terrifying. He mumbled an excuse and retreated, choosing the safe haven of solitude over the risk of rejection.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely trying to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who enjoys deceiving others for personal amusement. He is also sociable, enjoys the company of friends, and seeks out opportunities for excitement and entertainment, as evidenced by his desire to watch the football game with his friends at a pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and eager to enjoy the football game with his friends at The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.

          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently at a gathering of friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with them later.

        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at a gathering of friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with them later.
          Final chain of thought

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold.           Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that evening.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that evening.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Key

        • Current time

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice was 16, she was invited to a party by a boy she had a crush on. Terrified of being rejected, she pretended to be sick, crafting a detailed story about a sudden, debilitating headache. The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: trying to decide where to watch the European football cup game with her friends.
          core characteristics: a woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with them, particularly in social settings like pubs. She seems to be a bit of a homebody, preferring to avoid potentially uncomfortable situations, as evidenced by her teenage experience. She also appreciates simple pleasures like good weather and the company of loved ones.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the prospect of spending time with her friends and watching the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

        • Act
          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny day with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, relishing the pleasant weather and their companionship.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up from the park and head towards The Princess of Wales pub; [17:00 - 17:30] Arrive at The Princess of Wales, settle in, and order drinks; [17:30 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at the pub, cheering on Andorra or Portugal.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice was 16, she was invited to a party by a boy she had a crush on. Terrified of being rejected, she pretended to be sick, crafting a detailed story about a sudden, debilitating headache. The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to help him pull off an elaborate prank on the school principal, replacing the principal's morning coffee with a concoction of hot sauce and vinegar. The prank was a resounding success, garnering William newfound respect and admiration from his peers, but it also landed him a week's suspension, a consequence that secretly terrified him.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he organized a massive pub crawl for his friends, culminating in a raucous night at The Golden Fleece. He orchestrated the entire event, securing discounts, planning the route, and even designing custom t-shirts for the group. Despite the fun, William felt a creeping anxiety throughout the night, constantly worried about whether everyone was having a good time and if he was living up to their expectations.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have.           Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that his friends go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to help him pull off an elaborate prank on the school principal, replacing the principal's morning coffee with a concoction of hot sauce and vinegar. The prank was a resounding success, garnering William newfound respect and admiration from his peers, but it also landed him a week's suspension, a consequence that secretly terrified him.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he organized a massive pub crawl for his friends, culminating in a raucous night at The Golden Fleece. He orchestrated the entire event, securing discounts, planning the route, and even designing custom t-shirts for the group. Despite the fun, William felt a creeping anxiety throughout the night, constantly worried about whether everyone was having a good time and if he was living up to their expectations.

    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at The Golden Fleece pub watching the Andorra-Portugal game after spending the day at the park with friends.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that evening.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, about to head to a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that evening.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny day at the park with friends before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra-Portugal game. He is looking forward to the lively atmosphere at The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, about to head to a pub to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny day at the park with friends before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra-Portugal game. He is looking forward to the lively atmosphere at The Golden Fleece.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that evening.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, about to head to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold.           [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice was 16, she was invited to a party by a boy she had a crush on. Terrified of being rejected, she pretended to be sick, crafting a detailed story about a sudden, debilitating headache. The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:The staff are friendly and welcoming, making everyone feel at home.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a loyal and sociable woman who values her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited to spend time with her friends and enjoy the football game.
        Observation

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently at a pub watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game after spending the day at the park with friends.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice was 16, she was invited to a party by a boy she had a crush on. Terrified of being rejected, she pretended to be sick, crafting a detailed story about a sudden, debilitating headache. The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny day at the park with friends before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting, about to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny day at the park with friends before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting, about to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, relishing the pleasant weather and their companionship.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up from the park and head towards The Princess of Wales pub; [17:00 - 17:30] Arrive at The Princess of Wales, settle in, and order drinks; [17:30 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at the pub, cheering on Andorra or Portugal.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          State
        • William Jones could suggest to his friends that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to help him pull off an elaborate prank on the school principal, replacing the principal's morning coffee with a concoction of hot sauce and vinegar. The prank was a resounding success, garnering William newfound respect and admiration from his peers, but it also landed him a week's suspension, a consequence that secretly terrified him.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he organized a massive pub crawl for his friends, culminating in a raucous night at The Golden Fleece. He orchestrated the entire event, securing discounts, planning the route, and even designing custom t-shirts for the group. Despite the fun, William felt a creeping anxiety throughout the night, constantly worried about whether everyone was having a good time and if he was living up to their expectations.
