          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Jack Taylor's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor had a disappointing time watching the game at The Golden Fleece on May 15th but seems to be in better spirits on May 16th, making plans with friends to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game.
          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor had a bad time watching a game on May 15th but is feeling better on May 16th and planning to watch another game with friends.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching a game on May 15th but is feeling better on May 16th and planning to watch another game with friends.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor had a disappointing time watching the game at The Golden Fleece on May 15th but seems to be in better spirits on May 16th, making plans with friends to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently making plans with his friends to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely seek solace in the company of his friends, finding comfort in their presence and shared experiences.

          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is preparing to go watch a game at a pub, but is feeling down that not all of his friends will be joining him.
          Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing some emotional pain due to not all of his friends joining him for the game, and he is likely experiencing some fatigue.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling down because some of his friends are not joining him to watch a game at a pub. He is preparing to go to the pub and is likely experiencing fatigue.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is preparing to go watch a game at a pub, but is feeling down that not all of his friends will be joining him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a bittersweet situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go along with his friends' decision, even if he has a preference.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a retired professional, given his age and the fact that he spends his time socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and perhaps even a little relieved that his friends are open to going to The Princess of Wales, his preferred pub.
          core characteristics: a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety. He longs for connection and enjoys spending time with his friends, but often feels inadequate and holds back from fully engaging. He is a complex person with a poetic side, as evidenced by his early interest in poetry slams. Despite his shyness, he appreciates simple pleasures like sunshine, good company, and watching games at his favorite pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship and connection, but struggles with shyness and self-doubt.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship but struggles with shyness and social anxiety.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who deeply values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales.           Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White had a disappointing time watching a game at The Princess of Wales pub on May 15th but seemed to be in a better mood the next day when they met friends at Victoria Park.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, likely deciding where to go watch a soccer game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones had a bad time at a game on May 15th but is having a better time at Victoria Park on May 16th with friends. They plan to watch another game later that evening and are deciding where to go.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones had a bad time at a game on May 15th but is having a better time at Victoria Park on May 16th with friends. They plan to watch another game later that evening and are deciding where to go.
          Final chain of thought

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

They are planning to watch another game that evening and are discussing which pub to go to.

William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Golden Fleece, try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, or go along with the group's decision even if it isn't his preference.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?

It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have.         SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual who yearns for connection but struggles with shyness.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a poetry slam at the local library. He listened, mesmerized, as words flowed like liquid fire, expressing emotions he couldn't articulate. He longed to join them, to pour his own anxieties and dreams onto the stage, but the thought of speaking in front of an audience sent shivers down his spine. He left the library that night with a notebook full of scribbled verses, forever haunted by the courage he lacked.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to have a picnic in the beer garden of The Princess of Wales. As they laughed and shared stories, Alexander noticed a group of girls giggling at a nearby table. He longed to impress them, to show them the witty, charming person he felt he could be, but his tongue tied itself in knots. He retreated into silence, watching enviously as Jack effortlessly charmed one of the girls with his easy humor. The familiar feeling of inadequacy settled over him like a shroud.

As they laughed and shared stories, Alexander noticed a group of girls giggling at a nearby table. He longed to impress them, to show them the witty, charming person he felt he could be, but his tongue tied itself in knots. He retreated into silence, watching enviously as Jack effortlessly charmed one of the girls with his easy humor. The familiar feeling of inadequacy settled over him like a shroud.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a poetry slam at the local library. He listened, mesmerized, as words flowed like liquid fire, expressing emotions he couldn't articulate. He left the library that night with a notebook full of scribbled verses, forever haunted by the courage he lacked.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.

  • Jacob Walker

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. They are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social setting.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely trying to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          core characteristics: a charismatic and manipulative individual who enjoys deceiving others for personal amusement. He is also sociable, enjoys the company of friends, and seeks out opportunities for excitement and entertainment, as evidenced by his desire to watch the football game with his friends at a pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and eager to enjoy the football game with his friends at The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.

          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Key

          Value

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently at a gathering of friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with them later.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at a gathering of friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with them later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice was 16, she was invited to a party by a boy she had a crush on. Terrified of being rejected, she pretended to be sick, crafting a detailed story about a sudden, debilitating headache. The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: trying to decide where to watch the European football cup game with her friends.
          core characteristics: a woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with them, particularly in social settings like pubs. She seems to be a bit of a homebody, preferring to avoid potentially uncomfortable situations, as evidenced by her teenage experience. She also appreciates simple pleasures like good weather and the company of loved ones.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the prospect of spending time with her friends and watching the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Value

        • Alice Lewis's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Answer:

      • Identity characteristics

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: trying to decide where to watch the European football cup game with her friends.
          core characteristics: a woman who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with them, particularly in social settings like pubs. She seems to be a bit of a homebody, preferring to avoid potentially uncomfortable situations, as evidenced by her teenage experience. She also appreciates simple pleasures like good weather and the company of loved ones.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the prospect of spending time with her friends and watching the game.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice was 16, she was invited to a party by a boy she had a crush on. Terrified of being rejected, she pretended to be sick, crafting a detailed story about a sudden, debilitating headache. The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny day with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, relishing the pleasant weather and their companionship.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • William Jones could suggest that his friends go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to help him pull off an elaborate prank on the school principal, replacing the principal's morning coffee with a concoction of hot sauce and vinegar. The prank was a resounding success, garnering William newfound respect and admiration from his peers, but it also landed him a week's suspension, a consequence that secretly terrified him.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he organized a massive pub crawl for his friends, culminating in a raucous night at The Golden Fleece. He orchestrated the entire event, securing discounts, planning the route, and even designing custom t-shirts for the group. Despite the fun, William felt a creeping anxiety throughout the night, constantly worried about whether everyone was having a good time and if he was living up to their expectations.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the Ireland-Russia game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to help him pull off an elaborate prank on the school principal, replacing the principal's morning coffee with a concoction of hot sauce and vinegar. The prank was a resounding success, garnering William newfound respect and admiration from his peers, but it also landed him a week's suspension, a consequence that secretly terrified him.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he organized a massive pub crawl for his friends, culminating in a raucous night at The Golden Fleece. He orchestrated the entire event, securing discounts, planning the route, and even designing custom t-shirts for the group. Despite the fun, William felt a creeping anxiety throughout the night, constantly worried about whether everyone was having a good time and if he was living up to their expectations.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent a pleasant afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before watching the Andorra-Portugal game at The Golden Fleece, though he was disappointed that not all his friends joined him. He later enjoyed a morning at the market with his friends before another night of potential pub-watching for the Ireland-Russia game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Answer: William Jones spent yesterday afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and watching a soccer game. Today, he went to the market with friends and may watch another game later.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent a pleasant afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before watching the Andorra-Portugal game at The Golden Fleece, though he was disappointed that not all his friends joined him. He later enjoyed a morning at the market with his friends before another night of potential pub-watching for the Ireland-Russia game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the Ireland-Russia game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that his friends meet at The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent a pleasant afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before watching the Andorra-Portugal game at The Golden Fleece, though he was disappointed that not all his friends joined him. He later enjoyed a morning at the market with his friends before another night of potential pub-watching for the Ireland-Russia game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Golden Fleece to watch the Ireland-Russia game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest that his friends meet at The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because her friends did not all go to the pub she preferred.
          core characteristics: a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends. She appreciates simple pleasures like sunshine and good company, but also values her routines and preferences, as demonstrated by her disappointment when her friends didn't choose her preferred pub. While she is generally outgoing, she also has a tendency to avoid potentially uncomfortable situations, as seen in her teenage years.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, relishing the pleasant weather and their companionship.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoyed a sunny day in the park with friends, but felt disappointed when only a few of them joined her to watch the game at her preferred pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with her friends at a bustling market.
