          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoyed a sunny day in the park with friends, but felt disappointed when only a few of them joined her to watch the game at her preferred pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying coffee and pastries with her friends at a bustling market.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up from the park and head towards The Princess of Wales pub; [17:00 - 17:30] Arrive at The Princess of Wales, settle in, and order drinks; [17:30 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at the pub, cheering on Andorra or Portugal.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship but struggles with shyness and social anxiety.

          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to have a picnic in the beer garden of The Princess of Wales. As they laughed and shared stories, Alexander noticed a group of girls giggling at a nearby table. He longed to impress them, to show them the witty, charming person he felt he could be, but his tongue tied itself in knots. He retreated into silence, watching enviously as Jack effortlessly charmed one of the girls with his easy humor. The familiar feeling of inadequacy settled over him like a shroud.

It\'s my favorite.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White spent time with friends at a park and watched soccer games at pubs, but he was unhappy when not all his friends joined him at the pub.

          core characteristics: a shy and introspective individual who values friendship and connection but struggles with self-doubt and a fear of social situations.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White spent time with friends at a park and watched soccer games at pubs, but he was unhappy when not all his friends joined him at the pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship but struggles with shyness and social anxiety.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, likely deciding where to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently experiencing some loneliness and mild pain. He is with friends discussing where to watch a soccer game between Ireland and Russia.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he has a preference.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.

        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

        Instructions

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who craves connection but often tries to control those around him.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of his friends went to his preferred pub.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who enjoys manipulating others and thrives on excitement. He is drawn to deception and enjoys crafting elaborate stories to impress and control those around him. Despite his manipulative tendencies, he craves connection and desires to spend time with his friends, although he often tries to steer them towards his preferred activities and locations. He seems to enjoy pubs, particularly The Golden Fleece, and takes pleasure in the camaraderie and atmosphere they provide.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who craves connection but often tries to control those around him.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          Jack Taylor's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who craves connection but often tries to control those around him.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia football game.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of his friends went to his preferred pub.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who enjoys manipulating others and thrives on excitement. He is drawn to deception and enjoys crafting elaborate stories to impress and control those around him. Despite his manipulative tendencies, he craves connection and desires to spend time with his friends, although he often tries to steer them towards his preferred activities and locations. He seems to enjoy pubs, particularly The Golden Fleece, and takes pleasure in the camaraderie and atmosphere they provide.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoyed spending time with friends in the park and at a market, but was disappointed when not all of his friends went to the pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who craves connection but often tries to control those around him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who craves connection but often tries to control those around him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a better mood because he is spending time with friends in a pleasant setting.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, sharing stories and laughter.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, sharing stories and laughter.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?

Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a better mood because he is spending time with friends in a pleasant setting.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends, sharing stories and laughter.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
    Active player

      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who values her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.
          Chain of thought

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and cherishes simple pleasures.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her favorite pub, The Princess of Wales.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          core characteristics: a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures. She prefers to spend time with her friends at her favorite pub, The Princess of Wales, but is willing to compromise and go to other pubs if necessary. While she values her friendships, she can also be disappointed when her friends don't share her preferences.
          feeling about recent progress in life: experiencing a mix of emotions. While she clearly enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures, she also seems to be struggling with a sense of disappointment and loneliness, particularly when her friends don't choose to spend time with her at her favorite pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who values her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

      • Plan
          Key

          Value

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Key

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis prefers The Princess of Wales pub but her friends often choose The Golden Fleece; this leads to Alice feeling disappointed when they don't join her at her preferred location.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, likely enjoying a pleasant day in the park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis prefers The Princess of Wales pub but her friends often choose The Golden Fleece; this leads to Alice feeling disappointed when they don't join her at her preferred location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her favorite pub, The Princess of Wales.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and cherishes simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who values her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, likely enjoying a pleasant day in the park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, enjoying the sunshine and their company.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up from the park and head towards The Princess of Wales pub; [17:00 - 17:30] Arrive at The Princess of Wales, settle in, and order drinks; [17:30 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at the pub, cheering on Andorra or Portugal.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who values her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, likely enjoying a pleasant day in the park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, enjoying the sunshine and their company.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and a bit frustrated.
          core characteristics: a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions. He has a penchant for deception and enjoys crafting elaborate stories and scenarios to entertain himself and those around him. Despite his desire for connection, his need for control often hinders his ability to form genuine relationships.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"

          The current time is: [16 May 2015 10:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, but he can be disappointed when plans don't go as expected.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and a bit frustrated.
          core characteristics: a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions. He has a penchant for deception and enjoys crafting elaborate stories and scenarios to entertain himself and those around him. Despite his desire for connection, his need for control often hinders his ability to form genuine relationships.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, but he can be disappointed when plans don't go as expected.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub for the evening's game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub for the evening's game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
      Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
      William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
      Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
      Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?
      William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key
