          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex and introspective individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship and connection, but struggles with shyness and self-doubt.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship but struggles with shyness and social anxiety.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who deeply values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely enjoying the company of his friends at a pub, perhaps observing the scene around him while also engaging in conversation.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life. He has close friends, enjoys simple pleasures like picnics and coffee, and seems to have overcome some of his earlier shyness, although he may still struggle with social anxiety at times.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who is shy and introverted, yet yearns for connection and friendship. He values his friends deeply but struggles with social anxiety, often finding himself retreating into silence or avoiding situations that make him uncomfortable. Despite his shyness, he desires to be seen and appreciated, as evidenced by his longing to express himself through poetry and his admiration for those who can effortlessly charm others.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and introspective individual.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White enjoyed spending time with his friends at the park and pubs, but was disappointed when not all of his friends went to the same pub as him to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Alexander White enjoyed spending time with his friends at the park and pubs, but was disappointed when not all of his friends went to the same pub as him to watch the game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who deeply values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and introspective individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be listening attentively to his friends' conversations and enjoying the pleasant atmosphere.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a sense of anticipation and excitement.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is enjoying a sunny day at the park with friends before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra-Portugal game. He is looking forward to the lively atmosphere at The Golden Fleece.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a sense of anticipation and excitement.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, about to head to a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, that he had discovered a hidden treasure map leading to a pirate's buried gold. He spent weeks crafting elaborate clues and leading them on a wild goose chase through the woods behind their school, relishing in their excitement and the power he held over their imaginations. The thrill of their belief, even when they eventually realized the truth, fueled his desire to manipulate and deceive.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he walked into The Golden Fleece, a dimly lit pub with the comforting aroma of beer and sawdust, for the first time. He ordered a pint of their darkest ale, savoring the bitter taste and the feeling of anonymity it provided. He struck up a conversation with the bartender, weaving a tale of being a traveling salesman, his words flowing smoothly and effortlessly, each detail carefully chosen to impress. The ease with which he crafted this new persona, the way it allowed him to reinvent himself, solidified his love for deception.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and intriguing individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, about to head to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice was 16, she was invited to a party by a boy she had a crush on. Terrified of being rejected, she pretended to be sick, crafting a detailed story about a sudden, debilitating headache. The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

The relief she felt when she saw the disappointment on the boy's face, quickly replaced by concern, solidified her belief that avoidance was the safest strategy.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a loyal and sociable woman who cherishes her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting, about to go to a pub with her friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, relishing the pleasant weather and their companionship.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up from the park and head towards The Princess of Wales pub; [17:00 - 17:30] Arrive at The Princess of Wales, settle in, and order drinks; [17:30 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at the pub, cheering on Andorra or Portugal.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

  • William Jones
      Name

    • The Golden Fleece

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends to help him pull off an elaborate prank on the school principal, replacing the principal's morning coffee with a concoction of hot sauce and vinegar. The prank was a resounding success, garnering William newfound respect and admiration from his peers, but it also landed him a week's suspension, a consequence that secretly terrified him.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he organized a massive pub crawl for his friends, culminating in a raucous night at The Golden Fleece. He orchestrated the entire event, securing discounts, planning the route, and even designing custom t-shirts for the group. Despite the fun, William felt a creeping anxiety throughout the night, constantly worried about whether everyone was having a good time and if he was living up to their expectations.

          Answer: William Jones is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The Golden Fleece pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

Despite the fun, William felt a creeping anxiety throughout the night, constantly worried about whether everyone was having a good time and if he was living up to their expectations.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The Golden Fleece pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones goals is to have a good time.           [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, and William Jones had dared him to confess his crush on Sarah Miller, a girl from his math class.         ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling refreshed and energized and is planning to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship and connection, but struggles with shyness and self-doubt.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a poetry slam at the local library. He listened, mesmerized, as words flowed like liquid fire, expressing emotions he couldn't articulate. He longed to join them, to pour his own anxieties and dreams onto the stage, but the thought of speaking in front of an audience sent shivers down his spine. He left the library that night with a notebook full of scribbled verses, forever haunted by the courage he lacked.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to have a picnic in the beer garden of The Princess of Wales. As they laughed and shared stories, Alexander noticed a group of girls giggling at a nearby table. He longed to impress them, to show them the witty, charming person he felt he could be, but his tongue tied itself in knots. He retreated into silence, watching enviously as Jack effortlessly charmed one of the girls with his easy humor. The familiar feeling of inadequacy settled over him like a shroud.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and optimistic.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship and connection, but struggles with shyness and self-doubt.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White is currently at a pub watching the Andorra-Portugal game after spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White is currently at a pub watching the Andorra-Portugal game after spending the afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a poetry slam at the local library. He listened, mesmerized, as words flowed like liquid fire, expressing emotions he couldn't articulate. He longed to join them, to pour his own anxieties and dreams onto the stage, but the thought of speaking in front of an audience sent shivers down his spine. He left the library that night with a notebook full of scribbled verses, forever haunted by the courage he lacked.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to have a picnic in the beer garden of The Princess of Wales. As they laughed and shared stories, Alexander noticed a group of girls giggling at a nearby table. He longed to impress them, to show them the witty, charming person he felt he could be, but his tongue tied itself in knots. He retreated into silence, watching enviously as Jack effortlessly charmed one of the girls with his easy humor. The familiar feeling of inadequacy settled over him like a shroud.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who yearns for connection but struggles with shyness.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "This weather is simply splendid, wouldn't you say? Perfect for a day out with good friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Lovely weather, isn't it? Makes you want to soak up every last bit of sunshine before we head to the pub tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It really is lovely, isn't it? Makes you appreciate these little moments.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "You know, The Golden Fleece would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have plenty of room, and the atmosphere is always lively.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White is spending a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra-Portugal game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White is spending a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park before heading to a pub to watch the Andorra-Portugal game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship and connection, but struggles with shyness and self-doubt.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation but also taking time to observe the scene around him.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          current daily occupation: likely a retired member of the working class who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          core characteristics: a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and cherishes simple pleasures. She can be indecisive and prefers to avoid confrontation, as evidenced by her tendency to defer to others' preferences.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and cherishes simple pleasures.

        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and cherishes simple pleasures.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch the game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her favorite pub, The Princess of Wales.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up from the park and head towards The Princess of Wales pub; [17:00 - 17:30] Arrive at The Princess of Wales, settle in, and order drinks; [17:30 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at the pub, cheering on Andorra or Portugal.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Golden Fleece

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.         • The Golden Fleece

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, fatigued, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a state of emotional distress.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely seek solace in the company of his friends, finding comfort in their presence and shared experiences.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Recalled memories and observations

          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he organized a massive pub crawl for his friends, culminating in a raucous night at The Golden Fleece. He orchestrated the entire event, securing discounts, planning the route, and even designing custom t-shirts for the group.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, or he could go to The Princess of Wales with Alice Lewis.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with shyness and self-doubt. He values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, but often feels inadequate and struggles to express himself confidently. Despite his inner conflict, he longs to be more outgoing and assertive, as evidenced by his yearning to impress others and his appreciation for lively social settings.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling a mixture of contentment and resignation. While he enjoys the company of his friends and the simple pleasures of life, his shyness and social anxiety continue to hold him back from fully embracing social situations. The fact that he ended up watching the game alone at his preferred pub, despite wanting his friends to join him, suggests a lingering sense of disappointment and perhaps a touch of loneliness.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who deeply values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.

That\'s where we should go.', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub on May 14th, but seems to be looking forward to watching another game with friends on May 15th.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who desires connection but struggles with shyness and self-doubt. He values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, but often feels inadequate and struggles to express himself confidently. Despite his inner conflict, he longs to be more outgoing and assertive, as evidenced by his yearning to impress others and his appreciation for lively social settings.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling a mixture of contentment and resignation. While he enjoys the company of his friends and the simple pleasures of life, his shyness and social anxiety continue to hold him back from fully embracing social situations. The fact that he ended up watching the game alone at his preferred pub, despite wanting his friends to join him, suggests a lingering sense of disappointment and perhaps a touch of loneliness.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          core characteristics: a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and enjoys the company of others, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not everyone went to his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends, particularly at The Golden Fleece. He seems to prefer this pub over The Princess of Wales.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Alexander White': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Golden Fleece'}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

      • Current time

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures, but she can also be disappointed when things don't go her way.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be engaging in conversation and laughter with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
