          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures, but she can also be disappointed when things don't go her way.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

They are now preparing to watch another game at a pub that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and loyal woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and appreciates simple pleasures, but she can also be disappointed when things don't go her way.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be trying to convince her friends to go to her favorite pub, The Princess of Wales.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park; [16:00 - 17:00] Pack up from the park and head towards The Princess of Wales pub; [17:00 - 17:30] Arrive at The Princess of Wales, settle in, and order drinks; [17:30 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at the pub, cheering on Andorra or Portugal.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who craves connection but often tries to control those around him.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub for the evening's game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially when he can influence their decisions.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit frustrated.
          core characteristics: a complex individual with a penchant for manipulation and a desire for excitement. He enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions. He is also a working class individual who enjoys a good time and prefers to spend it at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently making plans with his friends to watch a soccer game.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor had a bad time watching a game on May 15th but is feeling better on May 16th and planning to watch another game with friends.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching a game on May 15th but is feeling better on May 16th and planning to watch another game with friends.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor had a disappointing time watching the game at The Golden Fleece on May 15th but seems to be in better spirits on May 16th, making plans with friends to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently making plans with his friends to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Golden Fleece to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece.
          [17:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game with friends at The Golden Fleece, enjoying drinks and snacks.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who craves connection but often tries to control those around him.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, his preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "You wouldn't believe what happened to me on the way here...
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we heading tonight for the game?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely try to steer the group towards his preferred pub for the evening's game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "So, about tonight, The Golden Fleece is showing the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a complex and manipulative individual who enjoys being in control and likes to spend time with his friends, particularly when he can influence their decisions.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently making plans with his friends to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • AllSimilarMemoriesWithoutPreAct

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely seek solace in the company of his friends, finding comfort in their presence and shared experiences.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is preparing to go watch a game at a pub, but is feeling down that not all of his friends will be joining him.
          Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing some emotional pain due to not all of his friends joining him for the game, and he is likely experiencing some fatigue.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling down because some of his friends are not joining him to watch a game at a pub. He is preparing to go to the pub and is likely experiencing fatigue.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling down because some of his friends are not joining him to watch a game at a pub. He is preparing to go to the pub and is likely experiencing fatigue.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere of the pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship and enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Answer: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship.

      • Current time

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker spins tales like a master storyteller, weaving intricate details and leaving you hanging on every word.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted individual who values friendship.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is preparing to go watch a game at a pub, but is feeling down that not all of his friends will be joining him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a bittersweet situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go along with his friends' decision, even if he has a preference.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White

    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is fine, but I was hoping we could all meet at The Princess of Wales. It's my favorite.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who values friendship but struggles with shyness and social anxiety.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is a good shout, actually. I quite like their selection of beers.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is showing the game, right? That's where we should go.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.

Alexander White just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight, anyone have a pub in mind for the game?

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and introspective individual.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?"
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely a retired professional, given his age and the fact that he spends his time socializing with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and perhaps even a little relieved that his friends are open to going to The Princess of Wales, his preferred pub.
          core characteristics: a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety. He longs for connection and enjoys spending time with his friends, but often feels inadequate and holds back from fully engaging. He is a complex person with a poetic side, as evidenced by his early interest in poetry slams. Despite his shyness, he appreciates simple pleasures like sunshine, good company, and watching games at his favorite pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, likely deciding where to go watch a soccer game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30 - 12:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends in Victoria Park.

          [12:00 - 13:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Princess of Wales to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          [13:00 - 15:00] Watch the game at The Princess of Wales, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie with friends.

          [15:00 - 16:00] Have a leisurely meal and drinks at the pub after the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, fancy heading over there?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who deeply values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a shy and introverted individual who values his friendships but struggles with social anxiety.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, likely deciding where to go watch a soccer game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, even if it wasn't his first choice, to avoid making a fuss.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Golden Fleece, try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, or go along with the group's decision even if it isn't his preference.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Golden Fleece, try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, or go along with the group's decision even if it isn't his preference.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at The Golden Fleece on May 15th but seems to be enjoying a sunny day with friends at Victoria Park on May 16th. They are planning to watch another game that evening and are discussing which pub to go to.

Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Golden Fleece, try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, or go along with the group's decision even if it isn't his preference.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.
